title: Do you think it would be fair if riot would unban your account if you made another one and...
body:
No chat restrictions or any reports against your accounts and reformed for one year. I think it sounds fair. And if anything at all happened on your original account after you get unbanned  it's a perm ban for both accounts.

You probably aren't suppose to make another account but let's face it, everyone does....

replies.body:
They tried a similar idea in which banned players had to reach level 30 on a new account.

Almost everyone failed.

If your account is banned, Riot doesn't want you playing their game anymore.

It's less so that if your account is banned that Riot doesn't want you playing League of Legends anymore, but rather there needs to be more of a deterrent/punishment than a temporary suspension for certain players to change their behavior. Riot welcomes players to create a new account if their account is suspended, but any prior accounts that are permanently suspended are not unsuspended, as they are the result of your prior actions and are subsequently a punishment for that behavior.

Well that's a shame. I thought it was a good idea, since one year is a long time and I was just thinking about all the skins you bought especially if you got rare skins like pax you couldn't get on a new account.

The whole point is, "don't be a dick or you'll lose all that expensive and exclusive stuff for ever". The real shocker is that people already know they're gonna lose all that crap and still are consistently toxic enough to warrant being permanently banned. And that after the chat restrictions and the 2 week ban. I mean, it's not an easy feat to be permabanned, you actually have to work hard to get to that point, and the proof is that only 0,006% of the player base gets hit by it despite how often you see people being super toxic in the game. And they do that KNOWING they'll lose all that stuff if they keep up?  

I honestly don't mean to be holier than thou here but it's really hard to find any sympathy at all for permabanned people. After all that hard work they SHOULD lose their stuff forever.

Yes however they will keep making new accounts and being toxic etc unless they have Some thing to look forward to. Aka everything they spent their money on. If not then they have no reason NOT to be toxic. You can now just buy accounts with tons of skins which is easier then lvling to 30 then rebuying them all. Seemed like a solution to me but oh well

If losing the money and time invested into the newer accounts isn't enough of an incentive to be a decent human being, I really doubt getting their old account back will be. The thing about people like that is that they just lack self control, it's simply beyond them to curb their impulses. It's like putting a steak in front of a starving dog and expecting it not it eat it. They WILL keep being toxic not matter how big the punishments or rewards may be, so the only thing Riot can do is to try to get them to go and stay go.

I've heard different reasons from different people.  

[Riot Tantrum](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/ZZkQvApM-new-feature-one-time-permaban-buyback?comment=000600000000) pretty much stated that perma-bans are meant to remove players from the community rather than reform them.  At that point, the player has shown they aren't really willing to reform and it spares other players from having to deal with them.

Though, that is obviously subject to context and makes your points no less valid.

You can't use the same email to make a new account. That alone makes it difficult for a player to prove their claims that they also own this other account that's bound to a different email. How is Riot to know that you're not being a good boy to free up your super toxic buddy's account? Secondly, basing it on IP addresses does not constitute as being the same owner. I see players playing in my local game store, so again, there is no way to prove that 2 separate emails are owned by the same person, and therefore, no way to prove that two separate accounts belong to the same person. As for "autobans" I don't think that's a real thing, considering that Riot has only announced 1 forever ban, and imaqtpie was not that person.
